page.title: 20WETHERBY TRAINING CENTRE
page.content: At the{Training Centre}we saw the manager, Mr. Darrell. Then we went into the dining room and saw the musicians. They were all physically or mentally handicapped. Some suffered from Down's Syndrome, their eyes were more to the side than ours. There was a work room and at each desk a teacher. We saw a teacher with five Down's sufferers who were all very friendly. The teachers try to be like mums and dads. There was a very thin short man called a Dutch Dwarf (a very happy man), he went up to a lady and tickled her. In the kitchen some people were making a cheese and onion pie. They like baking very much. The Training Centre is open for people between the ages of 16 and 65, who are physically or mentally handicapped, it aims to help them cope with daily life.
